titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 434: Legenda aurea

notesStmt.note: Title from Zacour-Hirsch Catalogue, no title page.

Incipit: Questa e la tavola...(f. 1r); Questo sono i sermoni dell'avento di Christo e poi drie segue le legende di sancti de la corte di Roma...[Text:] Tutto il tempo della vita presente se destingue in quatro...(f. 5r).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: An anonymous translation of the Golden Legend different from translation used in early printed editions. Description of G. Martini calls it "volgarizzamento del sec. XIV."

supportDesc.extent: 154 leaves : 228 x 155 (188 x 115) mm. bound to 235 x 170 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (modern paper) + 154 + i (modern paper); [1-154]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto; older foliation partly cut off in binding.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 49 lines; ruled in ink with vertical bounding lines.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive humanist script.

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials in red and blue with penwork decorations.

binding.p: Half calf; upper and lower cover detached.

history.provenance: S. Maria Angelorum, Ferrara; Giuseppe Martini.
Purchased by H. P. Kraus from the Martini collection, ca. 1948.
Appears in H. P. Kraus's list 189 (1956), no. 91.
